item.title: Daily Market Forecast Based on Algo Trading: Returns up to 35.21% in 3 Days
item.dc:creator: Dario
item.content:encoded:
Daily Market Forecast

An insider is legally permitted to buy and sell shares of the firm – and any subsidiaries – that employs him or her. However, these transactions must be properly registered with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and are done with advance filings. You can find details of this type of insider trading on the SEC's EDGAR database. This algorithmic forecast is for stocks with recently reported insiders' transactions.An "insider" is any person who possesses at least one of the following:

  • access to valuable non-public information about a corporation (for example a company's directors and high-level executives)
  • ownership of more than 10% of the company's equity
Package Name: Insiders Stocks
Recommended Positions: Long

The package itself saw an overall return of 5.55%, providing investors with a 4.52% premium above the S&P 500’s return of 1.03% for the same time period. The algorithm correctly predicted 8 out 10 of the suggested trades in the Energy Stocks Package for this 1 Year forecast. HNR was the highest-earning trade with a return of 180.83% in 1 Year. Additional high returns came from CLF and VALE, at 174.75% and 132.94% respectively. The package had an overall average return of 61.17%, providing investors with a 45.94% premium over the S&P 500's return of 15.23% during the period. Harvest Natural Resources Inc (HNR)., an independent energy company, engages in the acquisition, exploration, development, production, and disposition of oil and natural gas properties. It primarily holds interests in the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela; and a 66.667 percent interest in the exploration acreage offshore of the Republic of Gabon. As of December 31, 2015, the company, through its 20.4 percent interest in Petrodelta, S.A. had delivered approximately 14.8 MBls of oil and 3.9 billion cubic feet of natural gas. Harvest Natural Resources Inc (HNR). was founded in 1988 and is headquartered in Houston, Texas.
